title: Topic 001 Question 330
body: A company uses AWS Signer with all of the company’s AWS Lambda functions. A developer recently stopped working for the company. The company wants to ensure that all the code that the developer wrote can no longer be deployed to the Lambda functions.
Which solution will meet this requirement?
options: Revoke all versions of the signing profile assigned to the developer.
Examine the developer’s IAM roles. Remove all permissions that grant access to Signer.
Re-encrypt all source code with a new AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key.
Use Amazon CodeGuru to profile all the code that the Lambda functions use.
